intro: Buglossoides incrassata, commonly known as rough bugloss, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its blue to violet flowers and hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental plants. Buglossoides incrassata is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
